name: Progressive Idiopathic Facial Fibroplasia
chief_complaint: My face feels tight and is changing shape uncontrollably
symptoms: visual field obstruction from tissue overgrowth
physical_findings: irregular fibrotic plaques in subcutaneous tissue
unilateral malar prominence with woody induration

lab_results.skin biopsy: dense collagen bundles with fibroblast proliferation

treatment: staged surgical debulking with fat grafting
prognosis: guarded with progressive functional impairment likely without aggressive intervention
description: A rare, progressive fibroproliferative disorder of unknown etiology causing uncontrolled collagen deposition in facial soft tissues. Distinct from scleroderma by its localized presentation and lack of systemic involvement. Pathogenesis involves dysregulated fibroblast activity and abnormal extracellular matrix remodeling.
